title: One of the biggest problems with Azir is his manacosts
body:
A part of why Azir is such a beast lategame is that his manacosts do not grow on rank, they stay the same, unlike a lot of other champions. This makes him able to get a full build without even needing a mana or manaregen component, so he can go for even more of a crazy scaling build.
Giving him scaling manacosts could help limit that and force him to take {{item:3165}} or some other mana item that has less synergy (since CDR doesn't give him attackspeed anymore, for instance).
Of course he's still very complicated to balance due to his incredible power status in competitive yet very low winrate otherwise.

I am perfectly fine with Azir being a beast lategame.  The thing I dislike is that he is able to have a fairly safe earlygame and has access to too many tools during said earlygame.

One person suggested that we remove the damage on his Q and simply make it a re-positioning tool for his soldiers, an idea that I like quite a bit (of course he would need some buffs to compensate).  This would remove his burst potential (and significantly remove his earlygame presence, something that a lategame hypercarry really shouldn't have anyway)  while not really affecting his DPS (and I feel that DPS is farm more important for Azir's identity).

Please this.

And this would kind of help easily redefine him since they'd be able to put a lot of power in to something else. Way lower Q cooldown, for one. Ramping attack speed whenever his soldiers hit something maybe? Return the E shield? They'd have a lot of options, at least.

And yeah, Azir is totally a DPS mage. That's what people think of when they think of him, and his Q being so bursty takes away from that.

Well I would argue that Azir is supposed to be a beast late-game, that's his identity. Also having non-scaling mana costs has the disadvantage of high mana cost in the early game. 70 mana on rank 1 Q with terrible damage means that he actually needs to manage his mana and not spam his abilities. Good balance if you ask me.

His E should probably cost a lot more and refund some mana if he hits a target. You're currently not really rewarded that much for getting on top of Azir because he can always just E away. If Es cost were a little more significant then you'd at least get some reward for closing on him before he jumped away.
